item.title: Kaitlin add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "I regret nothing. There have been things I missed, but I ask no questions, because I have loved it, such as it has been, even the moments of emptiness, even the unanswered-and that I loved it, that is the unanswered in my life." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Kaitlin add a quote by Marcus Aurelius
item.description: "Never let the future disturb you. You will meet it, if you have to, with the same weapons of reason which today arm you against the present." -- Marcus Aurelius

item.title: Kaitlin add a quote by Junot Díaz
item.description: "Love is the great test of the human. The human is tested by our ability to withstand love. Love is so difficult, it is so challenging, it demands of us that we wreck it with ourselves. It demands of us an honesty that few of us could sustain." -- Junot Díaz

item.title: Kaitlin add a quote by Rob Bell
item.description: "It’s easy to take off your clothes and have sex. People do it all the time. But opening up your soul to someone, letting them into your spirit, thoughts, fears, future, hopes, dreams… that is being naked." -- Rob Bell

item.title: Kaitlin add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I am no bird; and no net ensnares me: I am a free human being with an independent will." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Kaitlin add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "I will not be "famous," "great." I will go on adventuring, changing, opening my mind and my eyes, refusing to be stamped and stereotyped. The thing is to free one's self: to let it find its dimensions, not be impeded." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Kaitlin add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
Kaitlin add a quote by Elizabeth I
item.description: "If I follow the inclination of my nature, it is this: beggar-woman and single, far rather than queen and married." -- Elizabeth I

item.title: Kaitlin add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "In yourself right now is all the place you've got." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Kaitlin add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I'll walk where my own nature would be leading. It vexes me to choose another guide." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Kaitlin add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Every path but your own is the path of fate. Keep on your own track, then." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Kaitlin add a quote by Carl Sandburg
item.description: "Time is the most valuable coin in your life. You and you alone will determine how that coin will be spent. Be careful that you do not let other people spend it for you." -- Carl Sandburg

item.title: Kaitlin add a quote by E.L. Konigsburg
item.description: "He also learned to regard each port of call as part of the journey and not as destination. Every voyage begins when you do." -- E.L. Konigsburg

item.title: Kaitlin add a quote by E.L. Konigsburg
item.description: "Happiness is excitement that has found a settling down place, but there is always a little corner that keeps flapping around." -- E.L. Konigsburg

item.title: Kaitlin add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "We must be willing to let go of the life we planned so as to have the life that is waiting for us." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Kaitlin add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "She couldn't be on his wavelength all the time. That's all. When you could recognize that and deal with it, you were on your way to an adult relationship." -- Stephen King

item.title: Kaitlin add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "Tell him yes. Even if you are dying of fear, even if you are sorry later, because whatever you do, you will be sorry all the rest of your life if you say no." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Kaitlin add a quote by Emily Bronte
item.description: "Whatever our souls are made of, his and mind are the same..." -- Emily Bronte

item.title: Kaitlin add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "We write to taste life twice, in the moment and in retrospect." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Kaitlin add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "And by the way, everything in life is writable about if you have the outgoing guts to do it, and the imagination to improvise. The worst enemy to creativity is self-doubt." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Kaitlin add a quote by Nora Ephron
item.description: "Above all, be the heroine of your life, not the victim." -- Nora Ephron

item.title: Kaitlin add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "You know, it's quite a job starting to love somebody. You have to have energy, generosity, blindness. There is even a moment, in the very beginning, when you have to jump across a precipice: if you think about it you don't do it." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Kaitlin add a quote by John Geddes
item.description: "...you want the sweetness of our beginning without the bitterness of our struggle - what are you asking - do you want light without shadow? ..." -- John Geddes

item.title: Kaitlin add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "Be worthy love, and love will come." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Kaitlin add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
Kaitlin add a quote by Junot Díaz
item.description: "You're the only person I've ever met who can stand a bookstore as long as I can." -- Junot Díaz

item.title: Kaitlin add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "Life should not be a journey to the grave with the intention of arriving safely in a pretty and well preserved body, but rather to skid in broadside in a cloud of smoke, thoroughly used up, totally worn out, and loudly proclaiming "Wow! What a Ride!" -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Kaitlin add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "A man who procrastinates in his choosing will inevitably have his choice made for him by circumstance." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Kaitlin add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "I hate to advocate drugs, alcohol, violence, or insanity to anyone, but they've always worked for me." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Kaitlin add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "So we shall let the reader answer this question for himself: who is the happier man, he who has braved the storm of life and lived or he who has stayed securely on shore and merely existed?" -- Hunter S. Thompson
